key_title: Key to the species of Bromus

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lower glume 1-nerved (uncommonly 3-nerved in lower half), upper glume 3-nerved
Lower glume 3–7-nerved, upper glume 5–9-nerved
Lemma (excluding awn) 20 mm or less; lower glume less than 15 mm; panicle lax or dense at maturity
Lemma (excluding awn) 20 mm or more; lower glume more than 15 mm; panicle lax at maturity
Rhizomatous perennial; leaf blades glabrous; awn of lemma (if present) entered by a single nerve; very rare, perhaps extinct weed in Victoria
Tufted annual; leaf sheaths, and usually blades, hairy; awn of lemma entered by 3 nerves
Panicle branches spreading at maturity, most pedicels longer than their (rarely purplish) spikelets (awns excluded)
Panicle branches remaining erect at maturity, pedicels shorter than their (often purplish) spikelets (awns excluded)
Panicle very lax, lower branches with only 1 or 2 spikelets; lemma 14–20 mm long
Panicle rather dense, lower branches bearing 4 or more spikelets; lemma 8–12 mm long
Panicle rather lax, pedicels of at least the lower spikelets more than 10 mm long
Panicle very dense, pedicels less than 10 mm long, spikelets often subsessile
Awn at least half as long as the lemma; annuals
Awn absent or no more than half as long as lemma; often perennials
Panicle lax, with branches often drooping, at least some pedicels usually longer than their spikelets (excluding awns)
Panicle rather dense, with branches more or less erect
Awn inserted more than 1.5 mm from apex of lemma
Awn inserted less than 1.5 mm from apex of lemma
Lemma of lowest floret 6.5–8.3 mm long
Lemma of lowest floret 8.5–11.5 mm long
Spikelet (excluding awns) less than 2 cm long, rather plump, awns remaining more or less erect
Spikelet (excluding awns) 2 cm long or more, strongly laterally compressed, awns spreading at maturity
Lemma hairy; awn at least one-third as long as body of lemma
Lemma glabrous (rarely with a few scattered hairs); awn lacking or less than one-third as long as lemma body
Glumes and lemmas sparsely hairy; lower glume (5.5–)7–12.5 mm long, upper glume (7–)9–14 mm long; awn 3–12 mm long, scabrous at base
Glumes and lemmas densely hairy; lower glume 3.5–7 mm long, upper glume 5.5–10 mm long; awn 3–6(–8) mm long, pubescent at base
